page.title: 12FRUIT GROWING
page.content: Several centuries ago much of the eastern part of the grid was covered by orchards but few now remain although many home-owners have an orchard as part of their gardens. Today some of this fertile land is fruit-farmed on a 'pick-your-own' basis. There are two such farms in the area. Kites Nest fruit farm to the north of Blakeney grows strawberry, raspberry, loganberry, tayberry and rhubarb. Although a pick-your-own farm, the fruit can be purchased ready-picked at a slightly higher cost. The farm gets many visitors in the summer and the most popular fruit is the strawberry so more of this fruit is grown. It is well equipped with water sprays and electric fences. Each row of growing fruit has its own water pipe and the fences are to deter rabbits and other animal invaders.
